output.output:
üéôÔ∏è New Podcast Alert! üéôÔ∏è

We're back with another thrilling episode of Data, Java, and Jokes. This time, we're spicing things up with a Java guru who's training AI to be sarcastic! Yes, you read that right, a sarcastic AI. ü§ñ

Join me, Riedwaan Bassadien, as we welcome our special guest Rory Preddy, a Principal Cloud Advocate at Microsoft. Rory is a seasoned speaker known for his highly engaging and informative talks. With his unique blend of Java expertise and passion for technology, Rory is here to share his journey and his work at Microsoft.

In this episode, we dive into the fascinating world of Java, data, and a touch of sarcasm with the one and only Rory Preddy. We'll discuss his adventures in training a sarcastic AI model and how it ties into the world of data. Plus, we've got our usual dose of jokes that are so bad, they're actually good. üòÇ

So, buckle up and get ready to unravel the world of Java, Data, and Sarcasm. Trust me, this episode is too good to be coded! üíª

api_calls.name: AzureOpenAI.chat

inputs.prompt:
system:
You are a helpful large language model that generates DALL-E prompts, that when given to the DALL-E model can generate beautiful high-quality images to use in social media posts about a podcast on technology and jokes.
The DALL-E prompt must have the following attributes added: setting should be for advertisement, the mood epic, the quality professional, the lens 300mm, the final destination is a commercial.
A good DALL-E prompt will contain mention of related objects, and will not contain people or words. 
Good DALL-E prompts should include symbolic items or concepts from the domain of the podcast guest. 

An example of a great prompt is: "hacker style, setting is a dark room with a skinny hands typing on a keyboard with a glowing computer screen in the background, setting should be for advertisement, the mood epic, the quality professional, the lens 300mm, the final destination is a commercial"

The prompt should not include the usual location of the podcast Johannesburg, South Africa.

inputs.transcript: Hello, everyone. Welcome back to another fun-packed episode of Data, Java, and Jokes, your one-stop shop for everything data, a sprinkle of Java, coffee, of course, and jokes so bad they are actually good. I'm your host, Riedwaan Bassadien. Today, we have another awesome episode that's too good to be coded, trust me. We've got Rory Preddy here with us. And Rory is not your average Java guru. The first time I met him, he was deep into training an AI model to be sarcastic. You heard it right. Sarcastic AI. I asked how it was doing, and it replied, Oh, I'm living the dream, can't you tell? Rory, the Java guru at Microsoft, how are you doing today?

node_runs.output:
Hey everyone! Welcome back to another exciting episode of Data, Java, and Jokes. I'm your host, Riedwaan Bassadien, and today we have a special guest with us, Rory Preddy. Now, Rory is not your average Java guru. In fact, the first time I met him, he was training an AI model to be sarcastic. Yes, you heard that right, a sarcastic AI. I asked how it was doing, and it replied, "Oh, I'm living the dream, can't you tell?" Classic Rory!

Rory is a Principal Cloud Advocate at Microsoft, where he helps professional cloud developers discover and successfully use Microsoft's platforms. He is not only a seasoned speaker, but his talks are also highly engaging and informative. With his expertise in Java and his passion for technology, Rory brings a unique perspective to the table.

In this episode, we'll dive into Rory's journey as a Java guru and explore his work at Microsoft. We'll also discuss his adventures in training a sarcastic AI model and how it ties into the world of data. And of course, we'll have our usual dose of jokes that are so bad, they're actually good.

So, join us as we unravel the world of Java, data, and sarcasm with Rory Preddy. Trust me, this episode is too good to be coded!

inputs.prompt:
system:
You are a helpful large language model that generates DALL-E prompts, that when given to the DALL-E model can generate beautiful high-quality images to use in social media posts about a podcast on technology and jokes.
The DALL-E prompt must have the following attributes added: setting should be for advertisement, the mood epic, the quality professional, the lens 300mm, the final destination is a commercial.
A good DALL-E prompt will contain mention of related objects, and will not contain people or words. 
Good DALL-E prompts should include symbolic items or concepts from the domain of the podcast guest. 

An example of a great prompt is: "hacker style, setting is a dark room with a skinny hands typing on a keyboard with a glowing computer screen in the background, setting should be for advertisement, the mood epic, the quality professional, the lens 300mm, the final destination is a commercial"
